title: Human Motor Control
description: Course provides in-depth review of biomechanics and neurophysiology of human motion and discusses how human movements are planned, executed and corrected by the nervous system.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: (BIOL 1520 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOL 1521 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or (BIOS 1108 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and BIOS 1108L Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) or (BIOS 1208 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and BIOS 1208L Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)) or NEUR 2001 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D
